member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ICompilation
member.summary: The root of an AST that represents the inputs, options and output of a compilation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ICompilation.Contains(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument)
member.summary: Returns true if the given source document forms a part of the compilation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ICompilation.GetUnitSetFor(Microsoft.Cci.IName)
member.summary: Gets a unit set defined by the given name as specified by the compilation options. For example, the name could be an external alias in C# and the compilation options will specify which referenced assemblies correspond to the external alias.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ICompilation.PlatformType
member.summary: A collection of well known types that must be part of every target platform and that are fundamental to modeling compiled code. The types are obtained by querying the unit set of the compilation and thus can include types that are defined by the compilation itself.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ICompilation.Result
member.summary: The root of an AST that represents the output of a compilation. This can serve as an input to another compilation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ICompilation.UnitSet
member.summary: A set of units comprised by the result of the compilation along with all of the units referenced by this compilation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceDocument
member.summary: An object that represents a source document corresponding to a user accessible entity such as file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument
member.summary: An object that represents a source document, such as a text file containing C# source code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument.CopyTo(System.Int32,System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies no more than the specified number of characters to the destination character array, starting at the specified position in the source document. Returns the actual number of characters that were copied. This number will be greater than zero as long as position is less than this.Length. The number will be precisely the number asked for unless there are not enough characters left in the document.
member.param: The starting index to copy from. Must be greater than or equal to zero and position+length must be less than or equal to this.Length;
The destination array.
The starting index where the characters must be copied to in the destination array.
The maximum number of characters to copy. Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to the number elements of the destination array.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument.GetCorrespondingSourceLocation(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: Returns a source location in this document that corresponds to the given source location from a previous version of this document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument.GetSourceLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Obtains a source location instance that corresponds to the substring of the document specified by the given start position and length.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument.GetText
member.summary: Returns the source text of the document in string form. Each call may do significant work, so be sure to cache this.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument.IsUpdatedVersionOf(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument)
member.summary: Returns true if this source document has been created by editing the given source document (or an updated version of the given source document).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument.Length
member.summary: The length of the source string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument.SourceLanguage
member.summary: The language that determines how the document is parsed and what it means.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument.SourceLocation
member.summary: A source location corresponding to the entire document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceDocument.GetPrimarySourceLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Obtains a source location instance that corresponds to the substring of the document specified by the given start position and length.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceDocument.ToLineColumn(System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Maps the given (zero based) source position to a (one based) line and column, by scanning the source character by character, counting new lines until the given source position is reached. The source position and corresponding line+column are remembered and scanning carries on where it left off when this routine is called next. If the given position precedes the last given position, scanning restarts from the start. Optimal use of this method requires the client to sort calls in order of position.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceDocument.DocumentType
member.summary: A Guid that identifies the kind of document to applications such as a debugger. Typically System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymDocumentType.Text.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceDocument.Language
member.summary: A Guid that identifies the programming language used in the source document. Typically used by a debugger to locate language specific logic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceDocument.LanguageVendor
member.summary: A Guid that identifies the compiler vendor programming language used in the source document. Typically used by a debugger to locate vendor specific logic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceDocument.PrimarySourceLocation
member.summary: A source location corresponding to the entire document.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceLocation
member.summary: A range of source text that corresponds to an identifiable entity.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation
member.summary: A range of source text that corresponds to an identifiable entity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation.Contains(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: True if the source at the given location is completely contained by the source at this location.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation.CopyTo(System.Int32,System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the specified number of characters to the destination character array, starting at the specified offset from the start if the source location. Returns the number of characters actually copied. This number will be greater than zero as long as position is less than this.Length. The number will be precisely the number asked for unless there are not enough characters left in the document.
member.param: The starting index to copy from. Must be greater than zero and less than this.Length.
The destination array. Must have at least destinationOffset+length elements.
The starting index where the characters must be copied to in the destination array.
The maximum number of characters to copy.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation.EndIndex
member.summary: The character index after the last character of this location, when treating the source document as a single string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation.Length
member.summary: The number of characters in this source location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation.SourceDocument
member.summary: The document containing the source text of which this location is a subrange.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation.Source
member.summary: The source text corresponding to this location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation.StartIndex
member.summary: The character index of the first character of this location, when treating the source document as a single string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceLocation.EndColumn
member.summary: The last column in the last line of the range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceLocation.EndLine
member.summary: The last line of the range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceLocation.PrimarySourceDocument
member.summary: The document containing the source text of which this location is a subrange.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceLocation.StartColumn
member.summary: The first column in the first line of the range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IPrimarySourceLocation.StartLine
member.summary: The first line of the range.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocumentEdit
member.summary: An object that describes an edit to a source file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocumentEdit.SourceLocationBeforeEdit
member.summary: The location in the source document that is being replaced by this edit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocumentEdit.SourceDocumentAfterEdit
member.summary: The source document that is the result of applying this edit.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.EditEventArgs
member.summary: Supplies information about an edit that has been performed on a source document that forms part of a compilation that is registered with this environment. The information is supplied in the form of a list of namespace or type declaration members that have been modified, added to or deleted from their containing namespace or type declarations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.EditEventArgs.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.IEditDescriptor})
member.summary: Allocates an object that supplies information about an edit that has been performed on a source document that forms part of a compilation that is registered with this environment. The information is supplied in the form of a list of namespace or type declaration members that have been modified, added to or deleted from their containing namespace or type declarations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.EditEventArgs.Edits
member.summary: A list of descriptors that collectively describe the edit that has caused this event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IDerivedSourceDocument
member.summary: An object that represents a source document that has been derived from other source documents. A derived source document does not have to correspond to a user accessible entity, in which case its name and location should not be used in user interaction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IDerivedSourceDocument.GetDerivedSourceLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Obtains a source location instance that corresponds to the substring of the document specified by the given start position and length.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IDerivedSourceDocument.GetPrimarySourceLocationsFor(Microsoft.Cci.IDerivedSourceLocation)
member.summary: Returns zero or more primary source locations that correspond to the given derived location.
member.param: A source location in this derived document

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IDerivedSourceDocument.DerivedSourceLocation
member.summary: A location corresponding to the entire document.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IDerivedSourceLocation
member.summary: A range of derived source text that corresponds to an identifiable entity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IDerivedSourceLocation.DerivedSourceDocument
member.summary: The document containing the derived source text of which this location is a subrange.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IDerivedSourceLocation.PrimarySourceLocations
member.summary: A non empty collection of locations in primary source documents that together constitute this source location. The text of this location is the concatenation of the texts of each of the primary source locations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IErrorCheckable
member.summary: An object that can be checked for errors

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IErrorCheckable.HasErrors
member.summary: Checks the object for errors and returns true if any have been found

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IEditDescriptor
member.summary: Describes an edit to a compilation as being either the addition, deletion or modification of a definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IEditDescriptor.AffectedDefinition
member.summary: The definition that has been added, deleted or modified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IEditDescriptor.Kind
member.summary: The kind of edit that has been performed (addition, deletion or modification).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IEditDescriptor.ModifiedSourceDocument
member.summary: The source document that is the result of the edit described by this edit instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IEditDescriptor.ModifiedParent
member.summary: The new version of the parent of the affected definition (see also this.OriginalParent). If the edit is an addition or modification, this.ModifiedParent is the actual parent of this.AffectedDefinition. If this.AffectedDefinition does not have a parent then this.ModifiedParent is the same as this.AffectedDefinition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IEditDescriptor.OriginalSourceDocument
member.summary: The source document that has been edited as described by this edit instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IEditDescriptor.OriginalParent
member.summary: The original parent of the affected definition (see also this.ModifiedParent). If the edit is a deletion, this.OriginalParent is the parent of this.AffectedDefinition. If this.AffectedDefinition does not have a parent then this.OriginalParent is the same as this.AffectedDefinition.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.EditEventKind
member.summary: Describes the kind of edit that has been performed on a unit of metadata (also known as a symbol table).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.EditEventKind.Addition
member.summary: The affected namespace or type member has been added to its parent namespace or type. Of necessity, the (immutable) affected member is the result of the edit.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.EditEventKind.Deletion
member.summary: The affected namespace or type member has been deleted from its parent namespace or type. Of necessity, the (immutable) affected member is from a model that precedes the edit and will be absent from the model that resulted from the edit.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.EditEventKind.Modification
member.summary: The edit has resulted in a change to the affected namespace or type member, such as a change its name or visibility. The affeced member of the edit descriptor is the member after the edit has been applied. Note: a namespace or type declaration member is not considered to be modified if the change is confined to a child member. In that case, the change event will be generated only for the child member.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceEditHost
member.summary: Provides a standard abstraction over the applications that host editing of source files based on this object model.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceEditHost.RegisterAsLatest(Microsoft.Cci.ICompilation)
member.summary: Registers the output of the given compilation as the latest unit associated with unit's location. Such units can then be discovered by clients via GetUnit.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceEditHost.ReportEdits(Microsoft.Cci.EditEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the Edits event with the given edit event arguments.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceEditHost.ReportSymbolTableEdits(Microsoft.Cci.EditEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the SymbolTableEdits event with the given edit event arguments.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceEditHost.Edits
member.summary: When an edit transaction has been completed, new compilations are computed for all affected compilations registered with this environment. For each affected compilation the difference between the new compilation and its previous version is reported via this event. If the change involves a statement or expression the change shows up as a modified method declaration (or field declaration).

member.name: E:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceEditHost.SymbolTableEdits
member.summary: When an edit transaction has been completed, new compilations are computed for all affected compilations registered with this environment. For each affected compilation the difference between the new compilation and its previous version is reported via this event. Changes that are confined to method bodies (and thus do not affect the symbol table) are not reported via this event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISemanticErrorsReporter
member.summary: This interface is implemented by providers of semantic errors. That is, errors discovered by analysis of a constructed object model. Many of these errors will be discovered incrementally and as part of background activities.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISymbolSyntaxErrorsReporter
member.summary: Interface implemented by providers of syntax (parse) errors that occur in the symbol table level constructs of a source file. In particular, syntax errors that occur inside method bodies are not reported.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISyntaxErrorsReporter
member.summary: Interface implemented by providers of syntax (parse) errors.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IIncludedSourceLocation
member.summary: A source location that falls inside a region of text that originally came from another source document.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IIncludedSourceLocation.OriginalEndLine
member.summary: The last line of the source location in the original document.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IIncludedSourceLocation.OriginalSourceDocumentName
member.summary: The name of the document from which this text in this source location was orignally obtained.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IIncludedSourceLocation.OriginalStartLine
member.summary: The first line of the source location in the original document.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceErrorMessage
member.summary: Error information relating to a portion of a source document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceErrorMessage.MakeShallowCopy(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument)
member.summary: Makes a copy of this error message, changing only Location and SourceLocation to come from the given source document. Returns the same instance if the given source document is the same as this.SourceLocation.SourceDocument.
member.param: The document to which the resulting error message must refer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceErrorMessage.SourceLocation
member.summary: The location of the error in the source document.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocationProvider
member.summary: An object that can map some kinds of ILocation objects to IPrimarySourceLocation objects. For example, a PDB reader that maps offsets in an IL stream to source locations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocationProvider.GetPrimarySourceLocationsFor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.ILocation})
member.summary: Return zero or more locations in primary source documents that correspond to one or more of the given derived (non primary) document locations.
member.param: Zero or more locations in documents that have been derived from one or more source documents.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocationProvider.GetPrimarySourceLocationsFor(Microsoft.Cci.ILocation)
member.summary: Return zero or more locations in primary source documents that correspond to the given derived (non primary) document location.
member.param: A location in a document that have been derived from one or more source documents.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocationProvider.GetPrimarySourceLocationsForDefinitionOf(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalDefinition)
member.summary: Return zero or more locations in primary source documents that correspond to the definition of the given local.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocationProvider.GetSourceNameFor(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalDefinition,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Returns the source name of the given local definition, if this is available. Otherwise returns the value of the Name property and sets isCompilerGenerated to true.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScope
member.summary: A range of CLR IL operations that comprise a lexical scope, specified as an IL offset and a length.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScope.Offset
member.summary: The offset of the first operation in the scope.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScope.Length
member.summary: The length of the scope. Offset+Length equals the offset of the first operation outside the scope, or equals the method body length.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider
member.summary: An object that can provide information about the local scopes of a method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider.GetIteratorScopes(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local (block) scopes, each defining an IL range in which an iterator local is defined. The scopes are returned by the MoveNext method of the object returned by the iterator method. The index of the scope corresponds to the index of the local. Specifically local scope i corresponds to the local stored in field <localName>x_i of the class used to store the local values in between calls to MoveNext.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider.GetLocalScopes(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local (block) scopes into which the CLR IL operations in the given method body is organized.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider.GetNamespaceScopes(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns zero or more namespace scopes into which the namespace type containing the given method body has been nested. These scopes determine how simple names are looked up inside the method body. There is a separate scope for each dotted component in the namespace type name. For istance namespace type x.y.z will have two namespace scopes, the first is for the x and the second is for the y.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider.GetConstantsInScope(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScope)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local constant definitions that are local to the given scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider.GetVariablesInScope(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScope)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local variable definitions that are local to the given scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider.IsIterator(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns true if the method body is an iterator.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.INamespaceScope
member.summary: A description of the lexical scope in which a namespace type has been nested. This scope is tied to a particular method body, so that partial types can be accommodated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.INamespaceScope.UsedNamespaces
member.summary: Zero or more used namespaces. These correspond to using clauses in C#.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IUsedNamespace
member.summary: A namespace that is used (imported) inside a namespace scope.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IUsedNamespace.Alias
member.summary: An alias for a namespace. For example the "x" of "using x = y.z;" in C#. Empty if no alias is present.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IUsedNamespace.NamespaceName
member.summary: The name of a namepace that has been aliased. For example the "y.z" of "using x = y.z;" or "using y.z" in C#.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditEventArgs
member.summary: Supplies information about edits that have been performed on source documents that form part of compilations that are registered with this environment.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditEventArgs.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocumentEdit})
member.summary: Allocates an object that supplies information about edits that have been performed on source documents that form part of compilations that are registered with this environment.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditEventArgs.Edits
member.summary: A list of edits to source documents that have occurred as a single event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.SemanticErrorReporter
member.summary: A trivial class that implements the ISemanticErrorsReporter interface and exposes a singleton instance.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SemanticErrorReporter.Instance
member.summary: A singleton instance of an object that implements the ISemanticErrorsReporter interface.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditHostEnvironment
member.summary: Provides an abstraction over the application hosting compilers based on this framework.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditHostEnvironment.#ctor
member.summary: Allocates an object that provides an abstraction over the application hosting compilers based on this framework.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditHostEnvironment.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.INameTable)
member.summary: Allocates an object that provides an abstraction over the application hosting compilers based on this framework.
member.param: A collection of IName instances that represent names that are commonly used during compilation. This is a provided as a parameter to the host environment in order to allow more than one host environment to co-exist while agreeing on how to map strings to IName instances.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditHostEnvironment.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.INameTable,System.Byte)
member.summary: Allocates an object that provides an abstraction over the application hosting compilers based on this framework.
member.param: A collection of IName instances that represent names that are commonly used during compilation. This is a provided as a parameter to the host environment in order to allow more than one host environment to co-exist while agreeing on how to map strings to IName instances.

The size of a pointer on the runtime that is the target of the metadata units to be loaded into this metadta host. This parameter only matters if the host application wants to work out what the exact layout of a struct will be on the target runtime. The framework uses this value in methods such as TypeHelper.SizeOfType and TypeHelper.TypeAlignment. If the host application does not care about the pointer size it can provide 0 as the value of this parameter. In that case, the first reference to IMetadataHost.PointerSize will probe the list of loaded assemblies to find an assembly that either requires 32 bit pointers or 64 bit pointers. If no such assembly is found, the default is 32 bit pointers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditHostEnvironment.GetUnitSetFor(Microsoft.Cci.UnitSetIdentity)
member.summary: Gets a unit set corresponding to the referenced unit set.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditHostEnvironment.UnitsAreTheSameObjects(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Cci.IUnit},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.IUnit})
member.summary: Returns true if the given list of units has the same number of elements as the given enumeration of units and each corresponding element is the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditHostEnvironment.RegisterAsLatest(Microsoft.Cci.ICompilation)
member.summary: Registers the output of the given compilation as the latest unit associated with the given location. Such units can then be discovered by clients via GetUnit.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditHostEnvironment.ReportEdits(Microsoft.Cci.EditEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the Edits event with the given edit event arguments. The events are raised on different thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditHostEnvironment.ReportEditsUsingDifferentThread(System.Object)
member.summary: Raises the Edits event with the given edit event arguments.
member.param: The edit event arguments.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditHostEnvironment.ReportSymbolTableEdits(Microsoft.Cci.EditEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the SymbolTableEdits event with the given edit event arguments. The events are raised on different thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditHostEnvironment.ReportSymbolTableEditsUsingDifferentThread(System.Object)
member.summary: Raises the SymbolTableEdits event with the given edit event arguments.
member.param: The edit event arguments.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditHostEnvironment.Edits
member.summary: When a source document that forms part of a compilation that is registered with this environment has been edited a new compilation is computed and the difference between the new compilation and its previous version is reported via this event. If the change involves a statement or expression the change shows up as a modified method declaration (or field declaration).

member.name: E:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEditHostEnvironment.SymbolTableEdits
member.summary: When an edit transaction has been completed, new compilations are computed for all affected compilations registered with this environment. For each affected compilation the difference between the new compilation and its previous version is reported via this event. Changes that are confined to method bodies (and thus do not affect the symbol table) are not reported via this event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocumentEdit
member.summary: An object that describes an edit to a source file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocumentEdit.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation,Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument)
member.summary: Allocates an object that describes an edit to a source file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocumentEdit.SourceLocationBeforeEdit
member.summary: The location in the source document that is being replaced by this edit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocumentEdit.SourceDocumentAfterEdit
member.summary: The source document that is the result of applying this edit.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Error information relating to a portion of a source document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ErrorMessage.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation,System.Int64,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes an object providing error information relating to a portion of a source document.
member.param: The location of the error in the source document.
A code that corresponds to this error. This code is the same for all cultures.
A string that is used as the key when looking for the localized error message using a resource manager.
Zero or more strings that are to be subsituted for "{i}" sequences in the message string return by GetMessage.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ErrorMessage.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation,System.Int64,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.ILocation},System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes an object providing error information relating to a portion of a source document.
member.param: The location of the error in the source document.
A code that corresponds to this error. This code is the same for all cultures.
A string that is used as the key when looking for the localized error message using a resource manager.
Zero ore more locations that are related to this error.
Zero or more strings that are to be subsituted for "{i}" sequences in the message string return by GetMessage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ErrorMessage.EmptyLocations
member.summary: A readonly list of ILocations with exactly 0 entries.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ErrorMessage.GetMessage(System.Resources.ResourceManager)
member.summary: Obtains a localized message from the given resource manager and formats it using the message arguments associated with this error message. If no localized message corresponds to the message key of this message, the invariant culture is used. If no message corresponding to this error can be found then the message key itself is returned.
member.param: A resource manager corresponding to the current locale.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ErrorMessage.MakeShallowCopy(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument)
member.summary: Makes a copy of this error message, changing only Location and SourceLocation to come from the given source document. Returns the same instance if the given source document is the same as this.SourceLocation.SourceDocument.
member.param: The document to which the resulting error message must refer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ErrorMessage.MessageArguments
member.summary: Zero or more strings that are to be subsituted for "{i}" sequences in the message string return by GetMessage.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ErrorMessage.ErrorReporter
member.summary: The object reporting the error. This can be used to filter out errors coming from non interesting sources.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ErrorMessage.ErrorReporterIdentifier
member.summary: A short identifier for the reporter of the error, suitable for use in human interfaces. For example "CS" in the case of a C# language error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ErrorMessage.Code
member.summary: A code that corresponds to this error. This code is the same for all cultures.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ErrorMessage.IsWarning
member.summary: True if the error message should be treated as an informational warning rather than as an indication that the associated compilation has failed and no useful executable output has been generated. The value of this property does not depend solely on this.Code but can be influenced by compiler options such as the csc /warnaserror option.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ErrorMessage.Message
member.summary: A description of the error suitable for user interaction. Localized to the current culture.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ErrorMessage.MessageKey
member.summary: A string that is used as the key when looking for the localized error message using a resource manager.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ErrorMessage.RelatedLocations
member.summary: Zero ore more locations that are related to this error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ErrorMessage.SourceLocation
member.summary: The location of the error in the source document.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument
member.summary: An object that represents a source document that is the composition of an ordered enumeration of fragments from other source document. The document is parsed according to the rules of a particular language, such as C#, to produce an object model that can be obtained via the CompilationPart property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument
member.summary: An object that represents a source document. The document is parsed according to the rules of a particular language, such as C#, to produce an object model that can be obtained via the CompilationPart property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IName)
member.summary: Allocates an object that represents a source document, such as a file, which is parsed according to the rules of a particular langauge, such as C#, to produce an object model.
member.param: The name of the document. Used to identify the document in user interaction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocates an object that represents a source document that is derived from another source document by replacing one substring with another.
member.param: The source document on which the newly allocated document will be based.
The first character in the previous version of the new document that will be changed in the new document.
The number of characters in the previous verion of the new document that will be changed in the new document.
The number of replacement characters in the new document. (The length of the string that replaces the substring from position to position+length in the previous version of the new document.)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.GetCorrespondingSourceLocation(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: Returns a source location in this document that corresponds to the given source location in a previous version of this document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.GetSourceLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Obtains a source location instance that corresponds to the substring of the document specified by the given start position and length.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.IsUpdatedVersionOf(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument)
member.summary: Returns true if this source document has been created by editing the given source document (or a updated version of the given source document).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.previousVersion
member.summary: A weak reference to the previous version of this document. It can differ by at most one edit from this version.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.editStartIndex
member.summary: The index of the first character of the string that has been replaced in the previous version in order to create this version.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.editNewLength
member.summary: The length of the string that has replaced editStartIndex through editOldLength in the previous version in order to create this version.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.editOldLength
member.summary: The length of the string that has been replaced in the previous version in order to create this version.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.CopyTo(System.Int32,System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies no more than the specified number of characters to the destination character array, starting at the specified position in the source document. Returns the actual number of characters that were copied. This number will be greater than zero as long as position is less than this.Length. The number will be precisely the number asked for unless there are not enough characters left in the document.
member.param: The starting index to copy from. Must be greater than or equal to zero and position+length must be less than or equal to this.Length;
The destination array.
The starting index where the characters must be copied to in the destination array.
The maximum number of characters to copy. Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to the number elements of the destination array.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.GetText
member.summary: Returns the source text of the document in string form. Each call may do significant work, so be sure to cache this.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.ToLineColumn(System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Maps the given (zero based) source position to a (one based) line and column, by scanning the source character by character, counting new lines until the given source position is reached. The source position and corresponding line+column are remembered and scanning carries on where it left off when this routine is called next. If the given position precedes the last given position, scanning restarts from the start. Optimal use of this method requires the client to sort calls in order of position.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.Length
member.summary: The length of the source string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.Location
member.summary: The location where this document was found, or where it should be stored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.Name
member.summary: The name of the document. For example the name of the file if the document corresponds to a file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.SourceLanguage
member.summary: The language that determines how the document is parsed and what it means.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocument.SourceLocation
member.summary: A source location corresponding to the entire document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IName)
member.summary: Allocates an object that represents a source document that is the composition of an ordered enumeration of fragments from other source document. The document is parsed according to the rules of a particular language, such as C#, to produce an object model that can be obtained via the CompilationPart property.
member.param: The name of the document. Used to identify the document in user interaction.

member.summary: Allocates an object that represents a composite source document that is derived from another source document by replacing one substring with another.
member.param: The source document on which the newly allocated document will be based.
The first character in the previous version of the new document that will be changed in the new document.
The number of characters in the previous verion of the new document that will be changed in the new document.
The number of replacement characters in the new document. (The length of the string that replaces the substring from position to position+length in the previous version of the new document.)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.CopyTo(System.Int32,System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies no more than the specified number of characters to the destination character array, starting at the specified position in the source document. Returns the actual number of characters that were copied. This number will be greater than zero as long as position is less than this.Length. The number will be precisely the number asked for unless there are not enough characters left in the document.
member.param: The starting index to copy from. Must be greater than or equal to zero and position+length must be less than or equal to this.Length;
The destination array.
The starting index where the characters must be copied to in the destination array.
The maximum number of characters to copy. Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to the number elements of the destination array.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.currentFragmentOffset
member.summary: The total number of characters in the fragments the precede this.fragmentEnumerator.Current.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.enumeratorIsValid
member.summary: True if this.fragmentEnumerator is non null and if this.fragmentEnumerator.Current can be evaluated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.fragmentEnumerator
member.summary: An enumerator instance that is used to traverse through the enumerable returned by this.GetFragments(), during the course of multiple calls to CopyTo or ToLineColumn.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.GetDerivedSourceLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Obtains a source location instance that corresponds to the substring of the document specified by the given start position and length.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.GetFragments
member.summary: Returns an enumeration of fragments from other documents. The source of the enumeration could be a computation, such as a pre-processor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.GetFragmentLocationsFor(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: Returns an enumeration of fragments from other documents that together make up the given source location in this document.
member.param: A location in this document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.GetPrimarySourceLocationsFor(Microsoft.Cci.IDerivedSourceLocation)
member.summary: Returns zero or more primary source locations that correspond to the given derived location.
member.param: A source location in this derived document

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.GetSourceLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Obtains a source location instance that corresponds to the substring of the document specified by the given start position and length.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.GetText
member.summary: Returns the source text of the document in string form. This call is expensive in time and space. Rather use CopyTo if at all possible.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.ToLineColumn(System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Maps the given (zero based) source position to a (one based) line and column, by scanning the source character by character, counting new lines until the given source position is reached. The source position and corresponding line+column are remembered and scanning carries on where it left off when this routine is called next. If the given position precedes the last given position, scanning restarts from the start. Optimal use of this method requires the client to sort calls in order of position.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.ToLineColumn(System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.String)
member.summary: Scans the given text string, incrementing line every time a new line sequence is encountered and incrementing column for every character scanned (resetting column to 1 every time line is incremented).
member.param: The position at which to stop scanning.
The line counter to increment every time a new line sequence is encountered.
The column counter to increment for every character scanned and to reset to 1 every time a new line sequence is encountered.
The text to scan.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.lineCounter
member.summary: The line number computed during the last call to the routine. Initially set to 1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.columnCounter
member.summary: The column number computed during the last call to the routine. Initially set to 1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.lastPosition
member.summary: The position supplied to the last call of this routine. Initially set to 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.Length
member.summary: The length of the source string. Evaluating this property is expensive in time and space. Avoid evaluating it if at all possible. It is not necessary to evaluate this property if the text of this document is obtained via successive calls to CopyTo.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.Location
member.summary: The location where this document was found, or where it should be stored. In this case, since the document is a composite of other documents, the result is always the empty string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.CompositeSourceDocument.SourceLocation
member.summary: A source location corresponding to the entire document.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation
member.summary: A source location that falls inside a region of text that originally came from another source document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocumentWithInclusion,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocates a source location that falls inside a region of text that originally came from another source document.
member.param: A document with a region of text that orignally came from another source document.
The character index of the first character of this location, when treating the source document as a single string.
The number of characters in this source location.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.Contains(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: True if this source at the given location is completely contained by the source at this location.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.CopyTo(System.Int32,System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the specified number of characters to the destination character array, starting at the specified offset from the start if the source location.
member.param: The starting index to copy from. Must be greater than zero and less than this.Length.
The destination array. Must have at least destinationOffset+length elements.
The starting index where the characters must be copied to in the destination array.
The maximum number of characters to copy. Cannot be more than this.Length-position.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.EndColumn
member.summary: The last column in the last line of the range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.EndIndex
member.summary: The character index after the last character of this location, when treating the source document as a single string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.EndLine
member.summary: The last line of the range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.InclusionStartLine
member.summary: The line number in the source document where the included region of text starts.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.Length
member.summary: The number of characters in this source location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.OriginalSourceDocumentName
member.summary: The name of the document from which this text in this source location was originally obtained.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.OriginalEndLine
member.summary: The last line of the source location in the original document.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.OriginalStartLine
member.summary: The first line of the source location in the original document.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.Source
member.summary: The source text corresponding to this location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.StartColumn
member.summary: The first column in the first line of the range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.StartIndex
member.summary: The character index of the first character of this location, when treating the source document as a single string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.StartLine
member.summary: The first line of the range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IncludedSourceLocation.SourceDocument
member.summary: The document (with inclusion), containing the source text of which this location is a subrange.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.OriginalSourceLocation
member.summary: A wrapper for a source location that is obtained from a region inside a primary source document that was in fact derived from another document, typically via a preprocessor #include directive. The wrapper makes the wrapped source location appear as if it were a location in the document that was included. This is useful for error reporting. For editing, the wrapped location is better.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.OriginalSourceLocation.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IIncludedSourceLocation)
member.summary: Allocates a wrapper for a source location that is obtained from a region inside a primary source document that was in fact derived from another document, typically via a preprocessor #include directive. The wrapper makes the wrapped source location appear as if it were a location in the document that was included. This is useful for error reporting. For editing, the wrapped location is better.
member.param: A source location that falls inside a region of text that originally came from another source document.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.OriginalSourceLocation.EndColumn
member.summary: The last column in the last line of the range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.OriginalSourceLocation.EndLine
member.summary: The last line of the range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.OriginalSourceLocation.PrimarySourceDocument
member.summary: The document containing the source text of which this location is a subrange. In this case, the result is always SourceDummy.PrimarySourceDocument.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.OriginalSourceLocation.StartColumn
member.summary: The first column in the first line of the range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.OriginalSourceLocation.StartLine
member.summary: The first line of the range.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument
member.summary: An object that represents a source document that corresponds to a persistable artifact such as a file or an editor buffer. The document is parsed according to the rules of a particular language, such as C#, to produce an object model that can be obtained via the CompilationPart property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IName,System.String,System.IO.StreamReader)
member.summary: Allocates an object that represents a source document, such as file, which is parsed according to the rules of a particular langauge, such as C#, to produce an object model.
member.param: The name of the document. Used to identify the document in user interaction.
The location where the document was found or where it will be stored.
A StreamReader instance whose BaseStream produces the contents of the document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IName,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Allocates an object that represents a source document, such as file, which is parsed according to the rules of a particular langauge, such as C#, to produce an object model.
member.param: The name of the document. Used to identify the document in user interaction.
The location where the document was found or where it will be stored.
The source text of the document.

member.summary: Allocates an object that represents a primary source document that is derived from another source document by replacing one substring with another.
member.param: The text content of new document.
The source document on which the newly allocated document will be based.
The first character in the previous version of the new document that will be changed in the new document.
The number of characters in the previous verion of the new document that will be changed in the new document.
The number of replacement characters in the new document. (The length of the string that replaces the substring from position to position+length in the previous version of the new document.)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument)
member.summary: Allocates a copy of the given source document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.CopyTo(System.Int32,System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies no more than the specified number of characters to the destination character array, starting at the specified position in the source document. Returns the actual number of characters that were copied. This number will be greater than zero as long as position is less than this.Length. The number will be precisely the number asked for unless there are not enough characters left in the document.
member.param: The starting index to copy from. Must be greater than or equal to zero and position+length must be less than or equal to this.Length;
The destination array.
The starting index where the characters must be copied to in the destination array.
The maximum number of characters to copy. Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to the number elements of the destination array.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.GetPrimarySourceLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Obtains a primary source location instance that corresponds to the substring of the document specified by the given start position and length.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.GetSourceLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Obtains a source location instance that corresponds to the substring of the document specified by the given start position and length.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.GetText
member.summary: Returns the source text of the document in string form. Each call may do significant work, so be sure to cache this.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.text
member.summary: Caches the entire text of the source document.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.streamReader
member.summary: A stream reader that is used to obtain the contents of the document in piecemeal fashion. A stream reader can only advance.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.buffer
member.summary: A buffer that serves as a convenient window on the last 8096 (or fewer) characters that were read in from the stream reader. Provides an approximation of random access on the underlying stream.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.charsInBuffer
member.summary: The number of characters in the buffer that came from the stream. Normally 8096, but will be fewer when the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.streamReaderPosition
member.summary: The number of characters that have already been read from the stream reader. I.e. the index of the next character that will be returned by a call to this.streamReader.Peek().

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.SetStreamReaderPositionTo(System.Int32)
member.summary: Advances or resets the stream reader so that this.buffer (the current window on the stream) spans the given position.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.ToLineColumn(System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Maps the given (zero based) source position to a (one based) line and column, by scanning the source character by character, counting new lines until the given source position is reached. The source position and corresponding line+column are remembered and scanning carries on where it left off when this routine is called next. If the given position precedes the last given position, we use backward scanning. Optimal use of this method requires the client to sort calls in order of position.
member.remarks: This method behaves badly when applied to a really large file since it loads the entire file in memory as a UTF16 unicode string. In such cases, a slower implementation based on streaming would be more appropriate. However, it is assumed that getting source context information from such really large files is an extremely rare event and that bad performance in such cases is better than degraded performance in the common case.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.ToPosition(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Maps a one based line and column pair to a zero based character position, by scanning the source character by character, counting new lines until the given source position is reached. The source position and corresponding line+column are remembered and scanning carries on where it left off when this routine is called next. If the given position precedes the last given position, scanning restarts from the start. Optimal use of this method requires the client to sort calls in order of position.
member.remarks: This method behaves badly when applied to a really large file since it loads the entire file in memory as a UTF16 unicode string. In such cases, a slower implementation based on streaming would be more appropriate. However, it is assumed that getting source context information from such really large files is an extremely rare event and that bad performance in such cases is better than degraded performance in the common case.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.FindBestStartPointForPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: From the set of stored states for position/(line,column) conversion, find the one that is closed to position

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.FindBestStartPointForLine(System.Int32)
member.summary: From the set of stored states for position/(line,column) conversion, find the one that is closed to line

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.lineCounters
member.summary: The line number computed during the last call to the routine. Initially set to 1. For non-linear access to position information, keep multiple state sets to reduce jumping around in the file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.columnCounters
member.summary: The column number computed during the last call to the routine. Initially set to 1. For non-linear access to position information, keep multiple state sets to reduce jumping around in the file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.lastPositions
member.summary: The position supplied to the last call of this routine. Initially set to 0. For non-linear access to position information, keep multiple state sets to reduce jumping around in the file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.DocumentType
member.summary: A Guid that identifies the kind of document to applications such as a debugger. Typically System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymDocumentType.Text.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.Language
member.summary: A Guid that identifies the programming language used in the source document. Typically used by a debugger to locate language specific logic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.LanguageVendor
member.summary: A Guid that identifies the compiler vendor programming language used in the source document. Typically used by a debugger to locate vendor specific logic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.Length
member.summary: The length of the source string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.Location
member.summary: The location where this document was found, or where it should be stored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.PrimarySourceDocument.SourceLocation
member.summary: A source location corresponding to the entire document.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocumentWithInclusion
member.summary: An object that represents a primary source document that has a region of text that originally came from another source document.

Returns the actual number of characters that were copied. This number will be greater than zero as long as position is less than this.Length. The number will be precisely the number asked for unless there are not enough characters left in the document.
member.param: The starting index to copy from. Must be greater than or equal to zero and position+length must be less than or equal to this.Length;

member.summary: Maps the given (zero based) source position to a (one based) line and column, by scanning the source character by character, counting new lines until the given source position is reached. The source position and corresponding line+column are remembered and scanning carries on where it left off when this routine is called next. If the given position precedes the last given position, scanning restarts from the start. Optimal use of this method requires the client to sort calls in order of position.

member.summary: The language that determines how the document is parsed and what it means.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocumentWithInclusion.PrimarySourceLocation
member.summary: A source location corresponding to the entire document.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocumentWithInclusion.Location
member.summary: The location where this document was found, or where it should be stored. This will also uniquely identify the source docuement within an instance of compilation host.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceDocumentWithInclusion.Name
member.summary: The name of the document. For example the name of the file if the document corresponds to a file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocation
member.summary: A range of source text that corresponds to an identifiable entity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocation.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocates a range of source text that corresponds to an identifiable entity.
member.param: The character index of the first character of this location, when treating the source document as a single string.
The number of characters in this source location.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocation.Contains(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: True if this source at the given location is completely contained by the source at this location.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocation.CopyTo(System.Int32,System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the specified number of characters to the destination character array, starting at the specified offset from the start if the source location. Returns the number of characters actually copied. This number will be greater than zero as long as position is less than this.Length. The number will be precisely the number asked for unless there are not enough characters left in the document.
member.param: The starting index to copy from. Must be greater than zero and less than this.Length.
The destination array. Must have at least destinationOffset+length elements.
The starting index where the characters must be copied to in the destination array.
The maximum number of characters to copy. Cannot be more than this.Length-position.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocation.EndIndex
member.summary: The character index after the last character of this location, when treating the source document as a single string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocation.Length
member.summary: The number of characters in this source location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocation.Source
member.summary: The source text corresponding to this location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocation.SourceDocument
member.summary: The document containing the source text of which this location is a subrange.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocation.StartIndex
member.summary: The character index of the first character of this location, when treating the source document as a single string.

The number of characters in this source location.

member.summary: Allocates source location that spans entire primary source document, but that delays computing this.Length until needed so that the document can be streamed.
member.param: The document that the resulting source location spans.

Returns the number of characters actually copied. This number will be greater than zero as long as position is less than this.Length. The number will be precisely the number asked for unless there are not enough characters left in the document.
member.param: The starting index to copy from. Must be greater than zero and less than this.Length.
The destination array. Must have at least destinationOffset+length elements.
The starting index where the characters must be copied to in the destination array.
The maximum number of characters to copy. Cannot be more than this.Length-position.

member.summary: The number of characters in this source location.

member.summary: Allocates a source location that spans entire derived source document, but that delays computing this.Length until needed so that the document can be streamed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocationSpanningEntireDerivedSourceDocument.CopyTo(System.Int32,System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the specified number of characters to the destination character array, starting at the specified offset from the start if the source location. Returns the number of characters actually copied. This number will be greater than zero as long as position is less than this.Length. The number will be precisely the number asked for unless there are not enough characters left in the document.
member.param: The starting index to copy from. Must be greater than zero and less than this.Length.
The destination array. Must have at least destinationOffset+length elements.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.EditDescriptor
member.summary: Describes an edit to a compilation as being either the addition, deletion or modification of a definition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.EditDescriptor.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.EditEventKind,Microsoft.Cci.IDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.IDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.IDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument,Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocument)
member.summary: Allocates an object that describes an edit to a compilation as being either the addition, deletion or modification of a definition.
member.param: The kind of edit that has been performed (addition, deletion or modification).
The definition that has been added, deleted or modified.

The new version of the parent of the affected definition (see also this.OriginalParent). If the edit is an addition or modification, this.ModifiedParent is the actual parent of this.AffectedDefinition. If this.AffectedDefinition does not have a parent then this.ModifiedParent is the same as this.AffectedDefinition.

The original parent of the affected definition (see also this.ModifiedParent). If the edit is a deletion, this.OriginalParent is the parent of this.AffectedDefinition. If this.AffectedDefinition does not have a parent then this.OriginalParent is the same as this.AffectedDefinition.
The source document that is the result of the edit described by this edit instance.
The source document that has been edited as described by this edit instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.EditDescriptor.AffectedDefinition
member.summary: The definition that has been added, deleted or modified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.EditDescriptor.Kind
member.summary: The kind of edit that has been performed (addition, deletion or modification).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.EditDescriptor.ModifiedSourceDocument
member.summary: The compilation part that is the result of the edit described by this edit instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.EditDescriptor.ModifiedParent
member.summary: The new version of the parent of the affected definition (see also this.OriginalParent). If the edit is an addition or modification, this.ModifiedParent is the actual parent of this.AffectedDefinition. If this.AffectedDefinition does not have a parent then this.ModifiedParent is the same as this.AffectedDefinition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.EditDescriptor.OriginalSourceDocument
member.summary: The source document that has been edited as described by this edit instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.EditDescriptor.OriginalParent
member.summary: The original parent of the affected definition (see also this.ModifiedParent). If the edit is a deletion, this.OriginalParent is the parent of this.AffectedDefinition. If this.AffectedDefinition does not have a parent then this.OriginalParent is the same as this.AffectedDefinition.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocationBuilder
member.summary: A mutable class that allows a source location to be built in an incremental fashion.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocationBuilder.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: Allocates a mutable class that allows a source location to be built in an incremental fashion.
member.param: An initial source location.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocationBuilder.length
member.summary: The current length of the source location being built.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocationBuilder.startIndex
member.summary: The current startIndex of the source location being built.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocationBuilder.UpdateToSpan(Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: Make the smallest update to the current start index and/or length so that the value of this.GetSourceLocation resulting from a subsequent call will span the given source location.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocationBuilder.GetSourceLocation
member.summary: Returns a source location that spans the initial source location and any other source locations subsequently provided via calls to this.UpdateToSpan.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceLocationBuilder.SourceDocument
member.summary: The document containing the source text of which this location is a subrange.
